suffer.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to experience physical or mental pain
suffer.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: At least he died suddenly and didn’t suffer.
She’s suffering a lot of pain.
suffer.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to have a particular disease or medical condition, especially for a long time
suffer.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Craig suffers from a rare bone disease.
The writer suffered from ill health for most of his life.
suffer.translation[0].definitions[1].not: In everyday English, people usually say that someone has a medical condition, rather than suffers from it:
suffer.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if someone suffers an unpleasant or difficult experience, or is in a difficult situation, it happens to them or they experience it
suffer.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Most of us have suffered the consequences of stupid decisions taken by others.
In June 1667, England suffered a humiliating defeat by the Dutch.
Small businesses have suffered financially during the recession.
They are unlikely to suffer any further loss of business.
He suffered head injuries in the crash.
A man who suffered serious brain damage during an operation is suing the hospital.
London employers were suffering from a desperate shortage of school-leavers.
suffer.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to become worse in quality because a bad situation is affecting something or because nobody is taking care of it
suffer.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Safety might suffer if costs are cut.
I’m worried and my work is beginning to suffer.
suffer.translation[0].note_box[0].headin: – Meaning 2: to have a particular disease or medical condition, especially for a long time
suffer.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: He died after suffering a massive heart attack.
The U.S. ship suffered no damage.
The team has now suffered five successive defeats.
Her preparations for the Olympic Games suffered a setback when she injured her leg during training.
The government suffered another blow when a report claimed that standards in education were falling.
Both companies have suffered heavy financial losses.
Research shows that children of alcoholic parents are more likely to suffer problems in adulthood.
If they cannot learn to adapt, they will suffer the consequences.
The town had suffered badly in the war.
The museum suffered financially under his administration.
suffer.translation[0].note_box[1].items[: You suffer from an illness, disease, or condition
You suffer injury, loss, damage, or pain
